page.title: 09Tourism
page.content: {Access}There is adequate, albeit narrow, road access via the B5282 from the A6 to the eastern shoreline of the estuary. Access to the western side is via the A590(T) Barrow road. The nearest rail link is 2 miles distant at Arnside. {Accommodation}Whilst the area attracts mainly day visitors, accommodation is available at the two inns and various bed & breakfast establishments on both sides of the estuary. More extensive accommodation is to be found nearby at Arnside and Grange over Sands. {Amenities}The estuary shoreline provides tourist attractions. Equable weather, superb views across the water to the Lake District mountains and spectacular sunsets together with a varied and rich ecology provide the main attractions. Angling, bird watching and rambling are popular.
